p: APAP treatment caused a marked decrease in the GSH t/GSSG ratio (13.24 ± 2.37, Fig. 5f and Supplementary data 1, P < 0.01). In APAP-treated mice, administration with silymarin (74.92 ± 13.60) or 1400 mg/kg/day GMSYS (71.67 ± 8.48) significantly increased the GSH t/GSSG ratio compared to that in the APAP group ( P < 0.05). Treatment with 700 mg/kg/day GMSYS increased the GSH t/GSSG ratio (39.87 ± 12.87) but not significantly, compared to that in the APAP group. Treatment with silymarin alone or 1400 mg/kg/day GMSYS alone showed no significant changes in the GSH t/GSSG ratio compared to that in the control group.
